GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1888 by decree of Archbishop of Santiago. Recognized by Pope Leo XIII 1889; became Pontifical University 1930. A private, autonomous institution, with degrees recognized by Chilean Law. Financially supported by State subsidy and tuition fees
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Licencia de Educación Media) and entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1953 as Business School of Valparaíso, acquired present status and title 1989
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Licencia de Educación Media) and entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1990. The historical background of the UnACh goes back to 1906, when the first Adventist College was created near the city of Temuco in Chile. The purpose was to prepare missionaries and teachers to support the Seventh-day Adventist Church in the country
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Licencia de Enseñanza Media), an interview with the program director and entrance examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1932 as Escuela Superior de Agricultura de Osorno. Acquired present status and title 1981
Founded 1989. Owned by Andrés Bello University since 2020

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1956. UCN gives its contribution to the world through its professionals trained in the various disciplines of knowledge, at the light of an education characterized by incorporating the principles of Christian Humanism and Social Vocation

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1738 by Philip V of Spain as Universidad de San Felipe. Replaced by present institution 1839, present title adopted 1842. Acquired present autonomous status 1931.

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1961 and attached to the State Technical University, and became its regional branch 1964. Became institute of professional studies 1981 and acquired present status and title 1981. Institute of Patagonia Studies, formerly private research institution, incorporated 1985. An autonomous institution financed by the State
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Licencia de Educación Media) and entrance examination (national selection)

GeneralInformation.History: The University's roots go back to the founding of the School of Arts and Trades in 1849 and the Schools of Mining in Copiapó, La Serena and Antofagasta. Later, Industrial Schools were founded in Southern cities and all these institutions became branches of the Universidad Técnica del Estado (State Technical University), founded in 1947. Acquired present title in 1981. An autonomous institution financed by the State
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Licencia de Educación Media) and national entrance examination (Prueba de selección universitaria (PSU))

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1981, incorporating regional branches of the University of Chile and University of Santiago de Chile. A State institution
